data.title: A unique fun activity
data.text:
You don't have to be the most artistic person to enjoy yourself here! First time I went last year was with my family and loved it so much, I took a friend here last weekend!

The staff is great and very knowledgeable. They were gracious enough to help us work with lace and answer questions on how to do sometime. 

Expect to spent a few hours here. They have a wide assortment of paint colors, stencils, stamps, sponges,etc to make your item yours!

Location is close to a few good restaurants as well so I would say its a great date activity as well. 

Note: It is quite pricey on the items (+ the $9 sitting fee)

data.title: Fun Family Activity
data.text: Been here a number of times. Staff is very helpful and accommodating. Great idea to spend time together and create a special personalized work of art to be cherished forever. Many events for groups and special interests. Especially nice to create keepsakes from your little ones!

data.title: Fantastic fun.
data.text: The staff has run several agirl ascout events for me. Great people! Christa and her staff work wekk with all ages, are very encouraging, and keep it no-stress for the kids.

data.title: Be creative with lots of help
data.text: Great place for a night out, a single project or ongoing classes.  The teachers are very knowledgeable and walk you through every step. You can show a pot on your first try with their expert help! The more you go, the better you get.  Also have a nice line of precast bisque ware that is ready to paint for a ladies night out.

data.title: Great place.... a bit pricy!
data.text: Love this place. Took the kids I babysit for here to "kill some time". While we had a great time, I do feel the prices are a bit high. I highly suggest getting prices verified before you pick a product.

data.title: Great way to spend time with the children
data.text: Whether you want to drop in and make something out of scratch with clay or use one of their pre-cast items, this is a great way to bring out the inner artist and create something beautiful.  The staff are friendly and more than willing to help.  During the summer, they offer morning and afternoon camps for children. You can sign up for as many or as few as you want. Each day is different and the children generally make useful items.

data.title: Fun for the kids, not the pocket.
data.text:
I have brought our kids here on a couple of occasions and have been blown away by the price each time.  The first time we did the story time with a pottery making lesson.  It was fun, but we were treated more like we were a nuisance than anything, as the owner seemed very overwhelmed. The kids liked seeing their finished work, but for the price, I would have rather bought my own stuff and done this at home multiple times.  

The next time we chose to just pick something and paint it.  I couldn't believe how expensive even that was, when I could go to Walgreens and get a whole kit for half the price.

That being said, it's a cool place ... But I'm not so sure about the price.

data.title: A fun activity for adults and children
data.text:
This is a “paint your own pottery” studio, and a fun experience for both kids and adults. After painting a piece of pre-formed pottery (such as mugs, plates, other tableware, and decorative pieces) with glazes, it is fired, and then you have a fully functional ceramic piece to use at home. Those who want to do more can take “wet clay” classes, and learn how to form traditional pottery on the wheel or by hand. It has a fun atmosphere, and the staff are very helpful and enthusiastic. You can just drop in to choose a piece of pottery and paint it, or take a short wet clay workshop. Time needed to do this is just dependent on the complexity of the piece, and how complex you want to get with your painting design. They also offer children’s pottery painting birthday parties. 

I am a customer; I have been taking adult wheel throwing classes there for about 3 years.
